net.sourceforge.gxl
Class GXLValidationException

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Throwable
        |
        +--java.lang.Exception
              |
              +--java.lang.RuntimeException
                    |
                    +--net.sourceforge.gxl.GXLValidationException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GXLValidationException
extends RuntimeException

Thrown when an operation that would render a GXLDocument invalid has been attempted.

For information on the different validation errors that might occur in a GXL document and when these exceptions are thrown, see the documentation on the field constants of this class.

Note that the current version of this GXL package DOES NOT validate against GXL schemas. This is a feature that might be added in a future version.

See Also:

Field Detail

INVALID_ELEMENT_TYPE

public static final int INVALID_ELEMENT_TYPE
All elements in a gxl file must be of a type described in the DTD. Thrown when a resource is read that contains non-GXL elements.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_CHILD_TYPE

public static final int INVALID_CHILD_TYPE
GXLElements only allow certain types of children. Thrown when a element is added to a parent that doesn't allow that particular type.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DUPLICATE_TYPE

public static final int DUPLICATE_TYPE
GXLTypedElements may at the most contain one GXLType. Thrown when a second type element is added to a already typed element.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DUPLICATE_VALUE

public static final int DUPLICATE_VALUE
GXLAttr may at the most contain one GXLValue. Thrown when a second value element is added to an attribute element already containing a value.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REQUIRED_VALUE_MISSING

public static final int REQUIRED_VALUE_MISSING
GXLAttr must contain one GXLValue. Thrown (1) when a value is removed from an attribute element or (2) when a non-valued attribute element is added to another element.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REQUIRED_ATTRIBUTE_MISSING

public static final int REQUIRED_ATTRIBUTE_MISSING
GXLElements must contain their required attributes. Thrown (1) when an element is added that doesn't contain all required attributes or (2) when a required attribute is removed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_ATTRIBUTE

public static final int INVALID_ATTRIBUTE
GXLElements must not contain any attributes not described in the DTD. Thrown when an attribute is set that isn't allowed by that particular element type.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_ATTRIBUTE_VALUE

public static final int INVALID_ATTRIBUTE_VALUE
GXLElement attributes must not contain invalid values. Thrown when an attribute with enumerated values is set to a non-allowed value. An example is the direction attribute of the relend attribute that can only be set to "in", "out" and "none".

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DUPLICATE_ID

public static final int DUPLICATE_ID
IDs must be unique throughout a GXLDocument. Thrown (1) when an element tree is added to a GXL document resulting in two or more elements having the same id, or (2) when the id attribute of an element is set to a value already used in the elements document.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_CONNECTION

public static final int INVALID_CONNECTION
GXLLocalConnections must refer to GXLGraphElements. Thrown (1) when an element tree is added to a gxl document resulting in the gxl document containing edges referencing non-GXLGraphElements, or (2) an attribute is changed, causing an illegal edge as described above.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DUPLICATE_NAME

public static final int DUPLICATE_NAME
GXLAttr name attribute must be unique to it's GXLAttributedElement parent. Thrown (1) when an attr element is added to a parent resulting in that parent containing two attr elements with the same name attribute, or (2) the name attribute of an attr element is changed so as to cause the above clash.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PROHIBITED_HYPERGRAPH

public static final int PROHIBITED_HYPERGRAPH
If GXLGraph hypergraph attribute is set to false, no relations are allowed. Thrown (1) when a relation is added to a graph not permitting it, or (2) when the hypergraph attribute is set to false on a graph containing relations.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PROHIBITED_DIRECTION_OVERRIDE

public static final int PROHIBITED_DIRECTION_OVERRIDE
If GXLGraph edgemode attribute is set to (un-)directed it cannot be overriden by isdirected attributes. If both directed and undirected edges is desired within the same graph, it's edgemode attribute must be set to defaultdirected or defaultundirected. Thrown (1) when an edge, with the isdirected attribute set, is added to a graph that doesn't allow override, or (2) when the edgemode or isdirected attribute is set, causing the above illegal override.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REQUIRED_RELEND_DIRECTION_MISSING

public static final int REQUIRED_RELEND_DIRECTION_MISSING
GXLRelend direction attribute must be set to GXL.IN/GXL.OUT if its GXLRel parent is directed. Thrown (1) when an element tree is added resulting in a directed relation containing a relend without the direction being set to GXL.IN or GXL.OUT, or (2) an attribute is changed, causing the above result.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_ORDER

public static final int INVALID_ORDER
Attributes from-/to-/start-/endorder must be integers. Thrown when one of the order attributes are set to a non-integer.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DUPLICATE_ORDER

public static final int DUPLICATE_ORDER
Attributes from-/to-/start-/endorder must be unique to their incident element. Thrown (1) when an element tree is added resulting in the ordering of incidences of an element containing duplicates, or (2) when a order attribute is changed, causing the above condition.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_URI

public static final int INVALID_URI
xlink in type/locator must be a valid uri. Thrown when the URI of a type or locator element is set to an invalid URI.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_INTERGRAPH_CONNECTION

public static final int INVALID_INTERGRAPH_CONNECTION
GXLGraphElements in differing top GXLGraphs cannot be connected. Thrown (1) when an element tree is added, resulting in an edge connecting elements from differing top graphs, or (2) when an attribute is modified to cause the above condition.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_MULTIGRAPH_TYPED_GRAPH

public static final int INVALID_MULTIGRAPH_TYPED_GRAPH
GXLTypes within a GXLGraph must all point to a single schema graph. This is currently not validated.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_SELF_REFERENCE

public static final int INVALID_SELF_REFERENCE
GXLLocalConnections must not reference themselves. Thrown when an attribute is set so as an edge will reference itself. Note that this is actually not prohibited in GXL, but this package sees no point in not doing it, and a lot of trouble in allowing it.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_VALUE

public static final int INVALID_VALUE
GXLAtomicValues must conform to their type (int, float and bool). Thrown when an atomic value is set to an invalid value.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DUPLICATE_VALUE_TYPE

public static final int DUPLICATE_VALUE_TYPE
GXLSet, GXLBag and GXLSeq must have elements of the same value type. Thrown when a value element is added to a bag, set or seq, causing it to contain more than one type of elements.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

UNSUPPORTED_VERSION

public static final int UNSUPPORTED_VERSION
Only GXL 1.0 is currently supported. Thrown when reading a GXL document that contains a DTD declaration not pointing to the gxl-1.0.dtd.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getType

public int getType()
Returns the type of validation error that caused this exception. This value should be compared to the constants found in this class if some particular action is to be taken.

Returns:
The type of validation error that caused this exception.
